summary: Email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an AT&T representative regarding the authentication of phone records for Jeffrey Epstein. The email attaches a 2004 AT&T wireless statement for Epstein and a proposed certification, with the goal of preparing a records custodian for potential testimony at a November trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The 2004 AT&T wireless monthly statement attached to the email is regarding his phone number.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, seeking to authenticate AT&T phone records for Jeffrey Epstein for use in a trial.

connections.description: The prosecutor is seeking to authenticate phone records belonging to Jeffrey Epstein for use in a legal proceeding.

events.title: AT&T Wireless Statement for Epstein
events.description: AT&T wireless monthly statement regarding Jeffrey E. Epstein's phone number is referenced as an attachment to the email.

events.title: Potential Trial
events.description: The email references a trial scheduled for November 2021, for which the authenticated records and a potential records custodian testimony are being prepared.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Southern District of New York were actively preparing evidence for a trial related to Jeffrey Epstein as of July 2021.
The evidence being authenticated includes a 2004 AT&T wireless monthly statement for Jeffrey Epstein's phone number.
The prosecution was seeking both a declaration of authenticity and a live records custodian who could testify at the November 2021 trial.
The communication indicates ongoing legal proceedings related to Epstein well after his death in 2019.
